title: Joe Kozlowsky
text:
Joseph Alexander Kozlowsky (August 9, 1901 – December 22, 1970) was a professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who spent <a href="1925%20NFL%20season">1925</a> - <a href="1930%20NFL%20season">1930</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> with the <a href="Boston%20Bulldogs%20%28NFL%29">Boston Bulldogs</a> and the <a href="Providence%20Steam%20Roller">Providence Steam Roller</a>. 
Prior to playing football professionally, Kozlowsky played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Boston%20College%20University">Boston College University</a>. While at Boston College, he was elected captain of the 1924 Eagle football team. In 1971, Kozlowsky was inducted into the Boston College Varsity Club Athletic Hall of Fame.
